definition: oracle inscriptions of the Shang Dynasty (16th-11th century BC) on tortoiseshells or animal bones
surname Bu
see 蘿蔔|萝卜[luo2 bo5]
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Chapter four makes a collection and arrangement in terms of Ho Group Hunting Oracle.
sentences.chinese: 第四章对何组田猎卜辞进行搜集和整理。

sentences.english: The article also demonstrates that the Huadong Group of divinations has orthographic similarities with the Li Group.
sentences.chinese: 以及指出了花东卜辞和历组卜辞在字体上的相似处。

sentences.english: The article also demonstrates that the Huadong Group of divinations has orthographic similarities with the Li Group.
sentences.chinese: 以及指出了花东卜辞和历组卜辞在字体上的相似处。

sentences.english: Bu must have a connection with the military system of Shang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 卜辞之“步”应与商代军制单位有关。

sentences.english: In Village South Series, identical soothsaying texts on Oracle Bones in Lizu and Wumingzu have different traits.
sentences.chinese: 屯南系列甲骨卜辞中历组和无名组同文卜辞各具特点。

sentences.english: In Village South Series, identical soothsaying texts on Oracle Bones in Lizu and Wumingzu have different traits.
sentences.chinese: 屯南系列甲骨卜辞中历组和无名组同文卜辞各具特点。

sentences.english: Chapter five sysemizes Ho Group Weather Oracle.
sentences.chinese: 第五章整理何组所见气象卜辞。

sentences.english: Yinxu is well know for bronzes, jades, and inscribed oracle bones unearthed from the site.
sentences.chinese: 遗址出土的青铜器，玉器，甲骨卜辞举世闻名。

sentences.english: However, there are four kinds of inscriptional evidence indicating that Yin calendar indeed is a prescriptive calendar.
sentences.chinese: 卜辞中有四项证据说明殷历确实是一部推步历。

definition: oracle bone/bone used for divination, esp. animal scapula
oracle script/oracle bone character (an early form of Chinese script)
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
tortoise shell and animal bones used in divination/oracle bone inscriptions (an early form of Chinese script)
Wu Ding (c. 14th century BC), legendary founder and wise ruler of Shang dynasty
Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
inscription in bronze/bell-cauldron inscription
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
divine by stalk
to predict by divining/to look into the future
Fu Hao (c. 1200 BC), or Lady Hao, female Chinese general of the late Shang Dynasty 商朝[Shang1 chao2]
Zuo Zhuan or Tsochuan, Mr Zuo's Annals or Mr Zuo's commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history c. 400 BC attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
to interpret the divinatory trigrams
ancient history
divination
